name: form

onmouseover.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

acceptcharset.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

onmousemove.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

scriptsrc.description:
Specifies the URL, relative to the web root, of the
            directory that contains the cfform.js file with the
            client-side JavaScript used by this tag and its child
            tags. For XML format forms, this directory is also the
            default directory for XSLT skins.

enablecab.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

style.description:
Styles to apply to the form. In HTML or XML format,
            Railo passes the style attribute to the browser
            or XML. In Flash format, must be a style specification
            in CSS format (XML and Flash type no supported).

codebase.description:
URL for a downloadable JRE plugin (for Internet explorer only). Default is
		/CFIDE/classes/cf-j2re-win.cab.

passthrough.description:
Used for HTML attributes that are not explicitly supported by cfform. If you specify an
		attribute and value, they are passed to the HTML code that is generated for the cfinput tag.

onreset.description: JavaScript to execute when the user clicks a reset button.

width.description:
The width of the form. Use a number to specify
            pixels, In Flash, you can use a percentage value to
            specify a percentage of the available width.

onmousedown.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

dir.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

accept.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

archive.description: URL for a downloadable Java classes for controls.

name.description: A name for the form you are creating.

enctype.description:
The MIME type used to encode data sent by the POST method. The default value is application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
		It is recommended that you accept the default value. This attribute is included for compatibility with
		the HTML form tag.

class.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

timeout.description:
Integer number of seconds for which to keep the
            form data in the Flash cache on the server. A value of
            0 prevents the data from being cached.

onclick.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

format.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

preloader.description:
Specifies whether to display a progress bar when
            loading the Flash form. Default is: true.

height.description:
The height of the form. Use a number to specify
            pixels, In Flash, you can use a percentage value to
            specify a percentage of the available width. The
            displayed height might be less than the specified size.

onerror.description: The name of a JavaScript function that runs if a form submission fails.

onmouseup.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

onkeydown.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

wmode.description:
Specifies how the Flash form appears relative to
            other displayable content that occupies the same
            space on an HTML page.
             - window: The Flash form is the topmost layer on the
            page and obscures anything that would share the
            space, such as drop-down dynamic HTML lists.
             - transparent: The Flash form honors the z-index of
            dhtml so you can float items above it. If the Flash
            form is above any item, transparent regions in the
            form show the content that is below it.
             - opaque: The Flash form honors the z-index of
            dhtml so you can float items above it. If the Flash
            form is above any item, it blocks any content that is
            below it.
            Default is: window.

accessible.description:
Specifies whether to include support screen readers
            in the Flash form. Screen reader support adds
            approximately 80KB to the SWF file sent to the
            client. Default is: false.

preservedata.description:
Optional. "Yes" or "No." Specifies whether to display the data that was entered into cfform
		controls in the action page. "Yes" resets the value of the control to the value submitted when the
		form is submitted to itself. This works as expected for the cftextinput and cfslider controls.
		This attribute can be used only if the form and action are on a single page, or if the action page has
		a form that contains controls with the same names as the corresponding controls on the form page.

onsubmit.description:
JavaScript function to execute after other input validation returns. Use this attribute to
		execute JavaScript for preprocessing data before the form is submitted

lang.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

id.description: HTML id passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

onmouseout.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

onload.description: JavaScript to execute when the form loads.

target.description: The name of the window or window frame to which the form output is sent.

onkeyup.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

onkeypress.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

action.description: The name of the page that executed when the form is submitted for processing.

title.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

ondblclick.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

description:
Builds a form with CFML custom control tags that provide more functionality than standard
  HTML form input elements (XML and Flash type not supported).
